Recap: Tony and Michelle suffered a second blast nearby. Rescue crew finally went back into the building to see if there was anyone else alive. At that time, Tony had recovered enough to carry Michelle to the entrance. Frank tried to take her from Tony but Tony panicked - unable to hear anything Frank was saying.

Eden was told she couldn't tell Bill she was still alive and blew a gasket, begging them to let him in on it. Harley had to deliver the bad news to Bill. Later, Bill found her ring among the ruins. Danny and Salerno toasted to Eden's demise. Danny found out that Michelle was trapped in the blast.
Transcript: Tony: Michelle! Michelle, please?! Michelle, please, please don't leave me. Michelle?! Please, Michelle?! Michelle, please. Michelle, stay with me. Stay with me, please. Okay. Please.
Michelle: Tony...
Tony: Stay with me, Michelle. You've got to stay with me. (Explosion) ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Eden: Yeah, I wasn't so sure for a minute. That bomb or whatever Danny set off was pretty close to me.
Jeffrey: Yeah, well, we had to make the scene real, Eden. I'm sorry.
Eden: Yeah, well, some of this blood is real. You told me I'd be safe in that office.
Jeffrey: Well, I'm sure Danny also told you that we had to make your death seem real. That we had to sell your death, Eden.

Eden: Yeah, "selling my death." What a concept. The only way to make Salerno think that the hit he put out on you was carried out was to convince frank and the cops and the fireman that you are gone. But I'm really am gone, aren't I? Aye! ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Danny: All right. To Eden. Here's hoping she's in a better place.

Eden: I knew that I would have to say goodbye to bill forever. But my god, I have to do it, Nicky. I can not let him think that I died on top of everything else.
Jeffrey: It's the only way, Eden.
Eden: You know what? I will not do this to bill and I won't let you do it either. (Knock at the door)
Harley: I'll get it. ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Tony: Don't touch her, please. Nobody touches her. She's hurt.

Eden: Don't do this. Please, Nicky. Don't go.

Eden: It is going to break his heart.
Jeffrey: Consider the alternative.
Eden: I have considered it.
Harley: Bill can not know that you are still alive, Eden.
Eden: (Crying) we all know. All of us. We are all keeping the secret. So can he.
Gus: It's not the same thing, honey.
Jeffrey: You've seen how bill reacts. Especially where Salerno is involved.
Eden: Okay, so he gets angry. So what?
Jeffrey: Irrational is more like it, wouldn't you say?

Eden: We can work this out. We can. Some how we can. Danny, you know, what if it was Michelle who blew up, huh? Wouldn't you want to know she wasn't really dead? Hey, Nicky, what if Harley was the victim? Would you rather someone told you a lie and said that she was dead?
Gus: Honey...
Eden: No! And what if you just got the news that Nicky was gone?
Jeffrey: All right, Eden, listen no one said it was going to be easy or fun, or even fair. You saw what bill did when he saw that Salerno was threatening you. He went and threatened Salerno.
Eden: You know what? He wouldn't do that again.
Gus: Oh, no?
Eden: No.
Gus: We don't know that.
Eden: Not if he was in on the plan he wouldn't!
Jeffrey: We don't know that.
Eden: He wouldn't.
Jeffrey: We don't know he wouldn't blow this whole thing up.
Gus: Bill would end up getting you both killed. You know it.

Jeffrey: Listen, Eden. Listen to me. What if we did let you go see bill? What would that accomplish? You might spare him a broken heart. But you might also get him killed. Because what's he going to do? What's hardheaded bill going to do when he finds out the lengths that you had to go to get away from Salerno? He's going to go right back at that guy and he's going to get himself killed. Is that what you want? Salerno had no problem putting a hit on you. He's going to have no problem putting a hit out on bill. It's not safe. And even you can see that.
Eden: How can you even do this? How can you look into bill's eyes and tell him a lie that's going to destroy him? (Crying) how can you do this?
Gus: It has to be done.
Harley: Then let me do it.
Gus: No, honey.
Harley: No, no. I know bill a lot better than you do. And you and Eden need to spend some time together while you still have time.
Jeffrey: Actually, that's not a bad idea. The closer you stay to Eden, the calmer she's going to be.
Gus: (Sighs) I... all right.
Harley: I'll be gentle with him. I will tell him how much you loved him.
Eden: Loved. Past tense. Loved. I'm already a ghost.
Gus: Well, no not to us you're not.
Eden: At least you won't have to spring for that maid of honor dress, huh?
Harley: No, Eden... you would have made a beautiful bride.
Eden: You will be one. That's another one that I'm going to miss. Oh, my god. Take care of Nicky. Please.
Harley: I promise. ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Tony: Forget it. Forget about me. Please. Okay, just take care of Michelle. Please. ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Gus: And you've always hated winter.
Eden: Uh-huh.
Gus: You remember you used to wrap your head so tight with that little yellow scarf of yours. Like a helmet.
Eden: Red.
Gus: Oh, it was red?
Eden: Not yellow. Red.
Gus: Like a helmet so you wouldn't (shivering sound) because the wind comes off Lake Michigan. Oh, January's.
Eden: Not my favorite time of year.
Gus: January's and the winter, yeah.
Eden: Not yours.

Gus: That's why I'm going to really... I'm going to lay it on O'Neill. They maybe set your new identity up in, like Maui or something. You could run a surf shop or one of those parasailing schools or something.
Eden: Oh, the sky's the limit, huh?
Gus: That's what I'm talking about. Starting over. So look, think about that. Starting over. Nobody in your life to judge you. No one just waiting around to watch you screw up, you know.
Eden: Oh, reinvent myself.
Gus: That's it. That's what I'm saying.
Eden: Talk about irony. All my life I wanted to be someone else, somewhere else. And now that's it's happening all I want to be is me living here with you and bill.
Gus: I just want you... just think about all the positives, you know.
Eden: Oh, Nicky, I was so close. So close to having the life I wanted... with the perfect guy.
Gus: Well, we don't live in a perfect world, you know.

Eden: I thought that I had finally outrun my past. But I guess you never do, huh? Look at me. Faking my own death so I can stay alive. Hiding out till I get my new identity. And what about Danny? He thought he was free and look at him.
Gus: What are we talking about?
Eden: Nicky, I... I want you to be careful. You know, you may think that you're safe with your past, clear of it. And I know that you want to take down that drug ring.
Gus: Oh, I will take it down. Trust me.
Eden: I know. If anyone can, you can. But it's dangerous needing something so badly. You know... it's like... it's like doing the right thing is your drug. Don't let it take over.
Gus: Take over what?

Eden: You have a great life with Harley. Don't let anything get in the way of you two getting married. Because you never know what's going to happen. Look at me. You never know what's going to happen. (Crying)
Gus: Shhhh. Come on.
Eden: No, it's not about me. It's about you. Please. Listen. Okay. (Knock at the door) ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ

Harley: He's making arrangements. I came in his place.

Billy: Hi. Come on in, Harley.
Bill: Harley, tell me what is going on? What was this explosion? Why is Eden at this warehouse?
Harley: Let's sit down.

Bill: Oh, my God.
Harley: I'm sorry.
Billy: She's gone. Oh, my God.

Bill: (Crying) you're wrong, Harley. You are... you are wrong. Because I just spoke to her a few hours ago. I have dinner and we're going to have champagne.
Harley: She loved you, bill. She loved you so much. You made her so happy.
Bill: No, no, no.
Harley: You have to know that.
Bill: No. I want to see her.
Billy: I don't think--

Bill: No, no, no. Where is she? Tell me where she is?
Billy: Whoa, whoa. Whoa, whoa. Whoa. Look, son, come here. We're going to get through this, okay? And...
Bill: How did this just happen? How did this happen?
Billy: I don't know.
Bill: How did this building just blow up?
Billy: Some things like this we're just not suppose to know.
Harley: They're not a hundred percent sure right now, but the fire marshal seemed convinced that it was just an accident, bill. It was just a horrible, horrible accident.
Bill: No. No, no. This was not an accident. This is Salerno. This is Salerno, dad.
Harley: Why do you say that?

Bill: He's scum. He's a scum. He said... he said... he swore to me that he didn't want her anymore, but he couldn't have her. And that's why Eden was scared. That's why Eden wanted to leave town. Don't you understand? She didn't trust a word that came out of that pig's mouth. And now...
Billy: This is just an accusation now you're making here.
Bill: Dad, I swear to you this is Salerno. This is Salerno and he has to pay. ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Alexandra: Oh, Alan and I thoroughly enjoy having children around, you know. I mean Lizzie, James, new baby Emma.

Ross: I'm glad to hear that everything is working out so well. But to be honest, when I first heard that Phillip and Olivia were going to be living there with the baby, visions of turf wars danced in my head.
Alexandra: No, no, it's absolutely... well, it's perfect amicable. Really.
Ross: Is that so?
Alexandra: All right, it's a perfect nightmare. First, I'm evicted from my bedroom, no one can touch baby Emma without expressed permission from Olivia. And my blood pressure is rising as we speak.
Ross: Oh, Alex, maybe you should be moving back in here.
Alexandra: No. No, no. I refuse to let Olivia push me or any member of my family out of our own home, Ross. I don't care if she wants to play queen bee at the moment.
Ross: (Laughs) you know, I bet you never thought that you'd be yearning for the good old days when Phillip and Blake were married?
Alexandra: (Laughs) well, you know, Olivia's made me appreciate Blake. (Laughs)
Ross: I will pass that message along to my bride. You know, I hope Phillip at this point and time will do whatever he has to do to make himself happy.

Alexandra: Yeah, well, I'm hoping that he has everything under control. To tell you the truth, I'm just slightly terrified that's going to let this sham of a marriage go on, and olivia do some damage to this family that can't be undone. ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Danny: Honey, I'm here at cedars. Call me. Tony? Hey, what happened to you?
Tony: Oh, I don't know. I guess I got caught in the middle of an exploding warehouse, Danny.
Danny: You followed me.
Tony: Hey, you had your job to do, I had mine. I didn't think you had it in you to whack anyone.
Danny: Tony, it was on Vinnie's order.
Tony: Oh, so that makes it okay, right? Makes it okay? Hm? Who was she, Danny? Who was she?
Danny: You don't know? It was Eden. Tony, she crossed Vinnie.
Tony: (Moans)

Tony: Yeah, so you're the one who's going to...
Danny: It was going to happen... it was going to happen whether I was part of it or not.
Tony: You're the lucky guy who got the job, right, Danny?
Danny: Vinnie was testing me. You know that.
Tony: Congratulations. You passed. Good job.
Danny: Tony. I'm sorry.
Tony: You're sorry.
Danny: I'm sorry. I know that you and Eden... look, Eden brought this on herself. She knew the risks. Tony, there have to be consequences for people's actions.
Tony: Well, you'd know that, wouldn't you? Tell me something, Danny...
Danny: Hey.
Tony: You tell me something right now?
Danny: What?
Tony: How did it go for you? How did the hit go? Huh? No damages? No collateral damage? None?
Danny: No. As far as I know.
Tony: As far as you know. Nothing, huh?
Danny: Why? Why?
Tony: Take a look. Take a look. Keep looking. Look. Who's on the table? ٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱٱ
Bill: Salerno is going down.
Billy: You've got to stop talking like this, bill.
Bill: Dad, what am I suppose to do? Eden was murdered. She'd be here right now if it wasn't for... he is a dead man. He is a dead man.
Harley: All the signs point to being an accident, Bill.
Bill: Harley, are you kidding me? This is not an accident. Salerno wanted Eden. He couldn't have her, so he killed her.
Billy: Bill, look. Look.
Bill: What?
Billy: You've got to have proof of this.
Bill: Proof, dad. There's proof out there. Buildings do not just blow up!
Harley: Hey. Okay, okay, where are you going right now?
Bill: I'm going to go pay someone a visit.
Harley: No, no, no.
Billy: I'm not going to let you do that.
Bill: Dad. Get out of my way.
Billy: Hey, look, I can't let you... hey, just listen to me.
Bill: Dad, will you just get out of my way?
